website_summaries.verdict: Many owners appreciate the use of rubber treads instead of an abrasive nonslip surface. Best for smaller, light-weight dogs and cats.
pros: Rubberized tread surface softer than sandpaper material
Uses side rails to guide animals safely
18" tread width encourages larger dogs to use the ramp
cons: Quality of rubber tread coating can be variable
Bulky, challenging to transport and set up

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed
customer_reviews.text: After reading endless reviews on available ramps, I decided to spend a little more and get this one. For a pregnant woman this product is NOT that heavy, easy to open/store, and well constructed. I drive a suburban and the ramp length is just right, making it not too steep for my older dog who cant jump in there anymore. Wide enough for her big-boned 80lb self, and the rubber traction is great on her paws. Happy I decided to go with this one!
customer_reviews.author: Candice D.

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and reliable
customer_reviews.text: I recently bought this dog ramp but have been super impressed with it. It’s easy for me to carry one handed and open up. I have a small SUV and it works perfectly for getting my 90lb dog in and out safely. It had suggestions to let the dog get familiar with the ramp on the ground and slowly work to the car. My dog is scared of a lot but doesn’t have a problem with using this ramp. Totally recommend getting this ramp it’s definitely worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Customer

customer_reviews.title: Duck ramp
customer_reviews.text: This has greatly improved the development of the ducklings at our neighborhood. Thankfully it comes with some holes at the top near the teeth, allowing us to tie it down to the ground. The teeth at the top helped give the ramp stability. Without this ramp, they otherwise wouldn't have access to the soil and everything that comes with it (insects, grasses, etc). This neighborhood obviously wasn't built with nature in mind. I'm sure there were economic reasons to build a "lake" like a pool smh.
customer_reviews.author: gerussi

customer_reviews.title: Dog doesn't care for the feel of it
customer_reviews.text: Like the idea. Purchased for an indoor use for a small dog and high places. He can climb it but didn't want to walk on the treads. I taped a rug on it and he will use the ramp without pause. Hint: if you are putting indoors on a wood floor, put a rug under the foot of the ramp that extends out from both sides. Protects the floor and keeps your pet from slipping on the floor when he tries to get on or off the ramp.
customer_reviews.author: BReview

customer_reviews.title: Very nice product
customer_reviews.text: It is a good product and works real well. It is very sturdy; our dog weights over 100 pounds and it is completely substantial for her. It is made of a heavy material which makes it a little cumbersome but I am a pretty small person. The material will hold up in rain or snow or whatever. It is made so that when you put it up to the tailgate, etc., it stays perfectly in place and won't slip. After use, it simply folds in half and has a clip that will lock it into place. Be careful of pinching your fingers is my only criticism. I recommend it to everyone
customer_reviews.author: Pammy

customer_reviews.title: This is our second Pet step ramp
customer_reviews.text: We had our first dog who loved the ramp to get in and out of our SUV. Our dog passed away ,so we gave our 16 year old pet step away 3 months ago. We just got a new dog and purchased another ramp because of the first ramps excellent performance!! We are so happy that nothing has changed, the great quality is still here in the new ramp 16 years later thanks!!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Leonard Aquilino

customer_reviews.title: Feels heavier than 18.5 pounds
customer_reviews.text: The senior Labs love it and so do I. Dogs have only used it 4 times in the 48 hours Ive had it, but I feel comfortable in saying it is high quality and easy to use. The dogs took to it immediately, but I admit they have used an old ramp (lesser quality) different brand for about a year now to board the pick up. This ramp is for my Subaru Outback and it works perfectly with the rear hatch set up. BTW, the little raised edge along the length of the border seems to offer extra confidence to the 15 year old Lab as he loads up.
customer_reviews.author: Fred

customer_reviews.title: This is the best dog ramp, on Amazon!
customer_reviews.text: I’m so happy! This is the 3rd ramp I’ve purchased, for my doggy. And my dog got on it, right away. It was because I showed him, that I could stand on it. That It was strong, heavy, and stayed in place. I didn’t want to buy my beautiful house, because of this high deck. And my 5 year old dog, within 2 years, was having leg problems. I’m so grateful!!! So thank you all Stuart 🐕 and Rhonda 🧘‍♀️💗
customer_reviews.author: RHONDA

customer_reviews.title: Dog did not slip!
customer_reviews.text: This my first ramp for my 65 pound elderly dog. Our pick-up is high off of the ground. This did help our dog get in and out of the truck. The surface is anti-slip and she was able to walk up and down without slipping. However, I did return them because they are just too heavy for my arthritic hands. I saw the weight on the information, but it really didn’t mean anything to me as far as how heavy they were really going to be. I returned them not because there was a problem with them. I’m in my 60s so I plan on ordering a different ramp that’s aluminum and a lighter weight.
customer_reviews.author: Missy B.

customer_reviews.title: Heavy and expensive
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Very durable and sturdy, with good traction going up the ramp. Cons: For the life of me I don't understand why it can't be half the weight, and price. Plus, in spite of my efforts, I did badly pinch my finger on the first try. It is much longer than I anticipated, so while the dog is sitting in the trunk area (it does not fit my 2016 Subaru Outback rear doors) you are scrambling to 'safely' fold it back and into the car. The dog must stay on command or it may try to jump out.
customer_reviews.author: Steven C.

customer_reviews.title: 3 Big Dogs and this ramp works terrific
customer_reviews.text: This is the second ramp I ordered.. this one is perfect for our 3 big dogs (2 shepherds and 1 boxer mix). We used it on our pontoon boat for the dogs to get on/off the boat when we beached it. While the angle is somewhat steep, our dogs all used it without any slipping or problem (even wet). I like that the treads did not get hot due to the light khaki color. Will use again and again. Great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: J in NC

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I was really hoping this would work for my older dog. He can't jump in/out of my SUV like he used to so hoped this would help. I was able to get him to go down the ramp but couldn't get him to go up it. He didn't like how it would give a little while walking up. Also his paws slip a little going up making him feel uneasy. The product itself is great. I didn't think it was that heavy and was easy to open and close. It's just my dog didn't feel confident and with his legs going out it was difficult for him to grip.
customer_reviews.author: TN

customer_reviews.title: NEVER USED ramp because my furry friend died.
customer_reviews.text: My Flat-Coated Retriever had a cancerous leg amputated in mid December and was adapting really well to three legs so I ordered and took delivery of the PetSTEP Original Folding Pet Ramp on Dec. 28th, 2018. Unfortunately the cancer had metastasized, and the last five days of her life were extremely rough for her. We were with her as she entered Doggie Heaven February 7th. The ramp was never used; it was simply removed from the box. I need to figure out how to return it in its original box to Amazon even though the last day of return was January 31, 2019. The Five Star rating is based on the great expectations I had of the product. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: gretchen

customer_reviews.title: Not sure if I hate it yet.
customer_reviews.text: The video is deceiving. You would have to practice A LOT to handle the ramp like the woman in the video. It is VERY VERY heavy and bulky to be handled by an older person. Yes, the rubber in the ramp is great for traction. I have a pickup and its not long enough when extended for an easy climb, nor its short enough for storage. It takes a lot of space and prone to breaking a paw/leg on a miss step while the dog is moving around. I havent figure out if i hate it yet.
customer_reviews.author: Rod Luc

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy but
customer_reviews.text: very well made. Very sturdy. Using this for my 68 lbs furbaby, who has arthritis and shouldn't be jumping into the vehicle. I'm fairly pretty strong, but found this to be a little heavy and somewhat bulky to fold. have to be really careful or you'll get pinched when trying to fold it. Does not fit to well in door of back seat entry but can make it work. not prefect but does help my baby tremendously. Not to pricey for how sturdy it is.
customer_reviews.author: Mj...

customer_reviews.title: Does what it's supposed to do.
customer_reviews.text: I got the ramp for my ageing lab as lifting her in and out of my Subaru was getting tiresome. It took a while to coax her into using it but after some practice with treats she got the hang of it and now is happy to use it to get in and out of the car. It is heavy and somewhat cumbersome to fold but I guess that's the caveat for the sturdiness. Overall it's a good purchase and will help my old girls joints as she ages, which is the most important part.
customer_reviews.author: dazzler11

customer_reviews.title: Good quality and easy to use, but big and bulky
customer_reviews.text: I guess you can't have it all, but I just wish it was a little smaller. It is slightly too long to fit lengthwise in the back of our jeep. After our dog climbs in the back, we have to fold it up and awkwardly place it horizontally in the back between the dog and the seats. it takes up a tremendous amount of space.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs Donovan

customer_reviews.title: Not a dog pool ramp
customer_reviews.text: Dog loves best.com links this ramp under “best pool ramps for dogs.” This is NOT a pool ramp and there is really no way to rig it to make it a pool ramp. It also does not come with legs, as that site shows. There is no hardware to keep it from folding up in the water, so if you’re looking for a pool ramp for dog safety, look elsewhere. I’m sure it’s fine for use on cars or other high surfaces.
customer_reviews.author: Miriam S Haffner

customer_reviews.title: good, it works,  but a bit heavy to carry.
customer_reviews.text: It works but its a bit too heavy to carry for me. difficult to pickbup, open, fold, replace... so i bought the doggie hammock instead for the backseat. dog prefers to have the back seat rests dropped down and have large cargo space in back half of car which is why i purchsd ramp...but sadly not working out for me. If youre tall and strong should be no problm...
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: Plastic broke in 4 days. Don't buy.
customer_reviews.text: We ordered May 30th and received June 1. We finally got to use it this weekend and it only lasted 4 days . It worked while it lasted but the plastic broke in 4 uses. I just checked and my return window was July 1. Don't buy. I spent 125.00 for only 5 uses. Not happy at all
customer_reviews.author: Cheri Osak

customer_reviews.title: Worth the Money
customer_reviews.text: Been working well for me and the doggies for years now. Will outlast the doggies. My three are getting a little older now having gone from the small truck to the full size pick-up, from farm house to town house - meaning grass and dirt to concrete, I needed to relieve the stress on each of their legs. This did the trick. Very handy. Very Handy.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth

customer_reviews.title: The step is easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I don't usually give my opinion, but this has been a tremendous help for my 13 year old 70 pound dog. The step is easy to use. It took minimal training to get him accustomed to it. It is sturdy but light enough for me to lift and position. It fits nicely on the steps into our home. It does not wobble or shift with him on it. He can no longer jump into the car, and we used it with the car today. I purchased the Side Entry Support Strap and it worked so easily. He went right up the ramp and into the car. I am so glad I got this ramp.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy G.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Quality
customer_reviews.text: I have a senior 115 lb. Alasskan Malamute. He can still jump into the back of our SUV, but I was concerned that one day he would injure himself doing so. After researching the various dog ramps at Amazon, I picked the PetSTEP Original Folding Pet Ramp. I have not been disappointed. It is more than adequate to support our dog's weight, and is also wide enough for him. Very sturdily constructed. With the use of treats, I was able to train him to use the ramp in minutes. Now, he is quite accepting of it, without the treats. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Stanley A.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Pet Ramp
customer_reviews.text: Excellent, sturdy, and really well made. Took some training but now the dogs scamper right up (big dogs too). It’s heavy, but I guess it kind of needs to be. No sharp edges so when the dogs are in the back we store this in the back seat with no concerns about the leather.
customer_reviews.author: BeccaBits

customer_reviews.title: Rubber surface
customer_reviews.text: I looked everywhere for a good ramp with a rubber surface. I did not want a ramp with flat sand paper like scratchy surface, they all looked slippery. It's really the rubber surface that sold me. This is it. My dog is 1 1/2 years old, 75lbs, and always refused to jump up into the back of the SUV. We have an Audi Q7, and this ramp fits great, holds steady, and doesn't scratch anything. Within 5 min, and 1 hotdog incentive, she is going up and down easily. We have to practice on busy roads now, but I'm very happy with the ramp itself.
customer_reviews.author: James Hill

customer_reviews.title: excellent product
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this for my 55 pound dog for 4 months and it is fantastic! It is sturdy and has excellent traction even in rain or snow. I have used it as a ramp for my minivan, outside stairs and indoors as a couch ramp. It is a bit heavy and I look forward to the time that my dog is all healed from her ccl surgery, but overall I a very grateful for this product.
customer_reviews.author: L. Bloom

customer_reviews.title: Hard to handle
customer_reviews.text: This ramp is very well built and sturdy, but has some definite design flaws. It's very cumbersome to maneuver without any handles. This makes folding very difficult and hazardous to fingers. There was almost no way to avoid folding it without pinching my hand. Folding flat would work, but you're laying it in the dirt. It's slightly too wide to store behind the front seat of my Forester.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara L Dickinson

customer_reviews.title: Not long enough, unsafe grip
customer_reviews.text: It is too steep for my dog to use to go up 5 steps onto our deck. The incline is even too steep for 4 steps. The ramp itself is narrow, and unsafe because the "treads" are virtually nonexistent, making them completely useless for a dog to have traction.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Allord

customer_reviews.title: Stable, sturdy
customer_reviews.text: My dog has trouble getting into the car and this PetStep is wonderful. Very stable, sturdy holds up to 500#. My dog is 11 yrs old and 106# so it is safe for her to walk up the ramp into the backseat. The strap for side of the car use is an excellent feature as it stabilizes the ramp. I followed the instructions for getting the dog used to the ramp and it worked very well. Used it flat inside on the way to her food and water (3 days), then outside on the steps (2 days) and only 2 days of use with treats into the back seat. Third day went right in with no coaxing.
customer_reviews.author: Maureen Finnerty

customer_reviews.title: Wish it didn't rust
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product, exactly as pictured and described. I purchased it for use in my pool because the dogs cannot see the steps. It worked brilliantly in that respect, however like other reviewer's have stated, everything rests almost immediately due to pool chemicals. It would be awesome if they could create a model specifically for this need.
customer_reviews.author: FeitclubTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Durable Yet Heavy
customer_reviews.text: Very durable, well-made, liked the heavy-duty rubber treads, very tactile steps so our Chocolate Labs wouldn't slip, easy fold/unfold, useful integrated handle. Everything about it was great and I would have kept it; however, it was just too heavy for me to transport daily from home-use to car-use. Even my husband said to buy something else that's lighter weight so he purchased one, but that model had the "sand paper" tread. We're still looking for a happy middle, a model that's light-weight but with the rubber treads. This model is a 5-star if I didn't have to transport it, kept it stationary at bedside, great for home-use. It's also a 5-star for people who can handle the weight.
customer_reviews.author: Hiker-A-Rama

customer_reviews.title: Great Sturdy Dog ramp
customer_reviews.text: I studied dog ramps and saw a youtube video on this one, a guy and his truck/ big dog... well I was sold. It's very well made and my 75 pound dog walks up then runs down without any bounce. It is not light weight but very doable... and because of the materials: it is sturdy. I use it for my 4 x 4 Tundra truck w/ extended cab. My dog rides inside the truck so I haven't used it for the bed. Shipped fast.
customer_reviews.author: LP

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, works well to get in the backseat of my pick-up.
customer_reviews.text: This works great for my American Bully to get into my pick-up. My back doors don’t open all the way so I was unsure of the fit, but we had no problem at all. A little heavy, but super sturdy. I was concerned over reviews on the types that had the sandpaper like surface, which is why I chose this ramp instead. It was a win for us! For reference, I have a GMC Canyon, four door.
customer_reviews.author: augustacooper

customer_reviews.title: Great item if I can get my dog to use it!
customer_reviews.text: It’s a good size and strong enough for my big dog. Just wish my big dog would use this, instead of trying to jump around this aid. She’ll get it eventually but I hope she doesn’t hurt herself first, silly doggie!
customer_reviews.author: Ka

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my Aging Dog
customer_reviews.text: As my dog is now 12ish and has various issues, she can no longer jump, especially into the car. I followed advice and started her on the ramp on the ground, then at a slight incline, using treats. She is very food-motivated, so she was perfectly happy to go get the treats. We now use the ramp to load her into the backseat of my CRV. I have a harness with a handle, so I stabilize her with that, but the ramp is sturdy and fits perfectly. She walks right on up.
customer_reviews.author: anne cassia

customer_reviews.title: Works good for above ground pool
customer_reviews.text: We used this ramp in our above ground swimming pool for our dog to get out of the pool. We built a deck for the outside of the pool and then We bought the pool legs from another website. The legs were supposed to easily screw into existing threads which did happen for 2/3 screws. One of the threads was not threaded but my husband was able to bolt it together. It made the process harder than is should have been but we figured it out.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Will return it
customer_reviews.text: Heavy and doesn't fit good . I should have known better. Spouse bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Delete account

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful ramp. Very sturdy & not slippery. A little awkward to fold/unfold at first just because it's large, but now we're pros. To start training our dog to use we laid it on the floor in front of back door for a week so he'd have to walk over to go out and in. Then moved to minivan. We stood along side so he'd not look down or jump on/off. Works Great! Also use now for full size truck & travel trailer. Rocco is 105lbs, 5 yrs old with recent knee surgery - plus a bit of phobia of camper stairs & shiney steps. This ramp has let him continue to travel with us & saved him from extra pain.
customer_reviews.author: J. McCarty

customer_reviews.title: Awesome investment - using for the past two years.
customer_reviews.text: Ramp folds in half super easy. Lays relatively flat in the trunk. I put blanket over it and my newf uses it as a pillow. :) Super sturdy. We use it for getting out of SUV trunk to prevent strain or injury, but she jumps into the trunk on her own. I did not have to spend a minute on training her to go up or down. Super easy to use and clean.
customer_reviews.author: Anarkissed

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, lightweight and as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy, lightweight and as advertised. I'm currently using it inside to make it easier for my 48 lb dog to navigate the 2 steps between my dining room and family room. She goes up and down with ease. It just took a few training sessions with treats for her to feel comfortable. My cat has loved this ramp since day one and thinks it's her personal lounging and play area. The ramp is also very easy to fold up and move. Happy with this.
customer_reviews.author: Zinnia

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy but not a quick flip open
customer_reviews.text: The ramp is sturdy and works great for a large dog, however, I feel it unfolds backwards, making it harder to flip it around and get it set up quickly for an anxious dog ready to get out of the car.
customer_reviews.author: LU

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I am a woman in her mid 50s and am out of shape. This is VERY easy to handle, set up, and put back again. I have 80 pound dogs who go up and down it easily. One of them is 16 and not very steady on her feet. The material on the ramp itself is non slip and she goes up and down it easily. Some people here complained about it being heavy, but I don't think it is............I want it to be sturdy for my bubs to walk up and down, and I think anything less heavy would be flimsy.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: The ramp was easy to use, sturdy and pet friendly. She learned to go right up. Now goes on her own. No more worrying about her jumping up or down and developing back/hip problems. And, no more lifting for us.
customer_reviews.author: Gma 15

customer_reviews.title: Finally a ramp that WORKS!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: After purchasing and returning four different kinds of ramps, I ordered this one it is totally FABULOUS. No training needed for my two very large, elderly labradoodles to go up and down it without one ounce of hesitation. It is sturdy enough to make them feel safe, yet light enough of me to lift it in an out my SUV without any effort. My only wish is that picking it up would have been much easier if there was a small handle on one of the sides but other than that...it is just PERFECT in every way. My BEST buy of the year.
customer_reviews.author: Frances Pendrous

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: I found this true to it's word on the weight it can hold. My dog has never used a ramp before but now being more of a senior dog with diabetes & arthritis I needed an more comfortable way for her to get in & out of my Rav. Her vision is poor & that is the only problem i had with her using it, it's narrow compared to my walkway & stairs so it took hands on guidance . I would highly reccomend
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for the Big Boys (and Girls)!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this early on for our Newfie puppy. He got used to it quickly and without issue. it is heavy duty and does not stow away in a small space, but it is very well made and will last a lifetime. Works well on both of our vehicles (one is lower to the ground than the other) and we'll most likely continue to use it once our pup is full grown and his puppy parts are good and solid!
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I spent more money for a better dog ramp. This ramp is very slippery when wet. Even though they warn about pinching fingers, watch out! The weigh of this folds on your fingers before you can straightened it out. Would never recommend
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A well made very sturdy ramp
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pet ramp, I bought my first one several years ago and needed a second one for our vacation home . It’s a well built Strong ramp with a excellent soft traction surface that won’t wear off. The down side is it is rather heavy and bulky compared to shorter ramps and some not that as strong. I have two Labradors that have not problem with it since it’s plenty wide.
customer_reviews.author: kevin

customer_reviews.title: Great product, easy to use, well made
customer_reviews.text: Our 60 pound rescue dog ran right up the ramp (with a little guidance) first time we used it. I can lift him in my Tahoe but after he has been swimming in our local lake he weighs a whole lot more than 60!! Ramp holds really well on my bumper and does not bounce when dog is walking up.
customer_reviews.author: Philip J Kenney

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, my dogs love it!
customer_reviews.text: By far the best ramp I’ve ever owned. Especially great for older dogs because the rubbery feeling textured ribs provide traction and toe holds.
customer_reviews.author: C.Wolf

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Light weight, but the plastic piece that the spring hooks onto when folded has broken. It does not affect the use of the ramp, but you need to lie flat when not in use to prevent from opening. The walking surface is rigid for grip, but not too rigid to deter our dog from walking on it. I would recommend this ramp. It's a good product for the price.
customer_reviews.author: T.D.G.

customer_reviews.title: Good product otherwise but slippery.
customer_reviews.text: Several users commented that this ramp was too slick. They were right. Going down is not a problem, but going up is. It's difficult enough to train some dogs to use a ramp, but much harder when they slip on it a few times. Guess I'll do what others have done and buy some artificial turf to glue on.
customer_reviews.author: D. Combs

customer_reviews.title: Not useful
customer_reviews.text: The PetSTEP folding pet ramp did not work for my golden retriever. He was slipping and falling on the ramp as he tried to walk up it. The ramp was also not wide enough for a dog of his size - male golden retriever, 80 lbs. I had to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Dabrowski

customer_reviews.title: I couldn’t walk on it barefooted on the floor and my dog definitely didn’t like it. Product was returned
customer_reviews.text: Was way heavier than I anticipated. Finish was peeling off in places and the tread design was different than pictured. I couldn’t walk on it barefooted on the floor and my dog definitely didn’t like it. Product was returned.
customer_reviews.author: GTIM2L8

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: This ramp i sturdy enough for my 14 year old lab, it has superior grip on it's treads. I have had to return many ramps. It is a bit awkward for me to maneuver but completely doable, it is safe and sturdy and NON SLIP ! Probably the safest dog ramp out there for your pet.
customer_reviews.author: new york

customer_reviews.title: Love this ramp!
customer_reviews.text: This ramp is so much better than our old one. Our dog uses this like a champ. It has molded "grippies" so it is non-slip even when it (or the dog) is wet. It also has edges on the sides which is nice. Our old one (different brand) had a "sandpaper-like" top which always scraped up my hands & arms when handling & folding. Also, it doesn't pinch your fingers when you're folding it up because there's a gap along both sides when folded.
customer_reviews.author: Roxy

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty
customer_reviews.text: A heavy duty ramp. I found it too heavy to easily move around and set up. Hurt my back lifting it in and out of the pickup bed. I exchanged it for the lighter model, which I love.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce

customer_reviews.title: This is a solid ramp for our golden
customer_reviews.text: We're very pleased with the ramp for our 80 lb dog. It works well with our SUV, using the back door or the side doors. It is a little heavy, but manageable. We used treats to lure her on, worked like a charm!
customer_reviews.author: Pam K

customer_reviews.title: This is the pet ramp you're looking for.
customer_reviews.text: This is the pet ramp you want. Do not buy the cheap aluminum-folding-chair-looking contraptions you see in big box Pet stores. This one is the one you need. It does NOT have sharp, jagged metal edges, and it does NOT have cheap sandpaper glued onto it to hurt your pets feet. (I mean, really ... Who thought putting coarse sandpaper on pet ramps is a good idea?) This ramp is sturdy; wide enough for large dogs; won't scratch your car's paint and has a rubberized ribbed surface to keep your pet from slipping.
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: Great outdoor pet ramp
customer_reviews.text: This ramp has been great for our dog, to go up/down the two steps from our house to backyard. The built-in treads give good traction without needing to worry about abrasive strips damaging her paws, or adhesive strips or material coming loose over time. The solid plastic surface is easy to clean in case of accidents. It’s easy to fold and position, and doesn’t sag when she crosses the hinge point in the center (she’s about 30#). We’ve had it for about 6 months with no issues, though it’s under a covered porch so I can’t say how it would do if left exposed to the elements.
customer_reviews.author: Tami Stawski

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Car when used with support strap
customer_reviews.text: Combined with the PetSTEP Side Entry Support Strap, this ramp works perfectly with my car. My black lab hurt one of his back legs so jumping in and out of my car is out of the question for him. I have a 2007 Mazdaspeed6 (same door as the Mazda6). The door does not open all the way so I have to use the support strap to support the corner of the ramp closest to the hinge of the door. I also use the ramp for helping my pup to get up to the back porch instead of using the three steps. (26 inches up from the ground). Works just fine. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Lightness of being
customer_reviews.text: This ramp is so easy to handle! One of my dogs has begun to use it up only for now going down scares him, everything in time
customer_reviews.author: Big Headed Man

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy and works well for my 70 pound mix
customer_reviews.text: We actually got this ramp to help my dog who was paralyzed for 10 days earlier in life. His back legs aren't the best because of it and have never recovered. The main function was so that he could get on the bed without jumping which is fairly high up. He can do it but the angles required for on/off the bed likely aren't the best for his back. Once he got used to it the ramp has become second nature.
customer_reviews.author: B. Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Folds nicely for storage
customer_reviews.text: Very solid ramp that is plenty wide. Folds nicely for storage. My Sr Lab loves the easy entry/exit of the truck cab. Not a concern for me, but you should note that this heavy duty ramp is on the heavy side if you think you may have trouble lifting. They clearly publish the weight in the description..
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Our old guy (dog that is) stopped using a step to get into our SUV. He just refused to jump anymore. So, we thought we'd try a ramp and it works great! He is about 70#, and this ramp has no problem with his weight, it's quite sturdy. It also folds nicely in half and stores flat in the luggage section in the back. It will also fit behind the front seats if needed.
customer_reviews.author: Judy A. Bloker

customer_reviews.title: Joint comfort for older dogs
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up and stow, more than sturdy enough for my 72 lb husky getting on in years. The ramp lets him avoid jumping out of the back of the Jeep Grand Cherokee (high rear deck) after a long drive.
customer_reviews.author: Mark M. Balenovic

customer_reviews.title: Be careful not to pinch your fingers
customer_reviews.text: The ramp is heavy, not the easiest to set up and take down. It is very sturdy and dogs don't slip on it. Be careful when putting up and taking dow it will pinch your fingers . We use ours in our motor home to which we have a smaller door way to set this up. I'm sure it would be easier to set up on a truck or an SUV. You would need to try for yourself to see how it works out for you it is a little heavy
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Maybe It's Us?
customer_reviews.text: This is a good sturdy ramp, for younger pet owners it will work fine. But if you are older it is a little to heavy to manage and it does take up a lot of space in the back seat. Quality is fine. Excellent for large dogs.
customer_reviews.author: C. Hildebrandt

customer_reviews.title: Thank you, this was an awesome purchase!
customer_reviews.text: This works great on my outdoor deck stairs for my aging 10lb dog. She was scared at first but I assisted her in going down and up a few times and she's a pro now. The grips on the stairs help her in feeling more comfortable. Has held up through rain, snow and ice. So glad I made this purchase for my little one. It can get icy so just be sure to watch your babies when it gets slick out.
customer_reviews.author: Ceci719

customer_reviews.title: Great ramp!
customer_reviews.text: I love this ramp and own two of them. One of them has been in constant use for 5 years and (aside from a little dirt) is just like new. These ramps are truly built to last. It is a nice heavy weight which makes it stable underfoot. The treads make it safe for the dogs even when they are at a dead run. I use one of these outside the doggy door to span a 2 1/2 foot drop. The dogs love it. It is more expensive than many other ramps, but it's worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn Bonin

customer_reviews.title: Good for a vehicle
customer_reviews.text: This would work really well to help a pet into a car or truck. We bought it to help a dog who is fearful of water with entry/exit of a pool. For that use case, it's not useful because it is too light in the water to stay in place.
customer_reviews.author: D. Woodall

customer_reviews.title: Bulky & Flexes Too Much
customer_reviews.text: Overall, the ramp flexed too much under my dog's weight (85 lbs.), so she refused to walk on it. The ramp folds easily enough; but, it's not flat. Once folded, it's still fairly bulky, so unless you have a large trunk/load area big enough to hold both your pup and the ramp, this ramp isn't very convenient. My car is a mid-sized SUV and this ramp was just too bulky.
customer_reviews.author: no name

customer_reviews.title: Durable, Sturdy, and Quality Product - Purchased Almost 2 Years Ago and Still Consider it an Excellent Product.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for a long while. I have a Maltese that can't jump up on my bed. So, I put this at the foot of my bed, and the dog loves it and uses it all the time. This is a heavy, sturdy, and durable product. You can wash it off and wipe it down, and I find it easy to carry into that back bedroom that stays locked when the housekeeper come to clean the house. It is heavy, but manageable. I've had it for almost 2 years and the springs, latches, hinges - everything is working as well as the day I received it. Would not give way with a much heavier than 15 pound dog.
customer_reviews.author: Jaded Princess

customer_reviews.title: Very big and very heavy
customer_reviews.text: This product works as advertised and after researching it’s the best I found, but it’s very heavy and big and bulky. I purchased this for my 70 lb dog to get in and out of the back of my small SUV which I bought for him to be able to ride in the back. The ramp is SO big, it takes up like half of the back where my dog rides. In a few years when he will really need this, I hope I’m able to still lift it!
customer_reviews.author: Shelly

customer_reviews.title: Heavy, but well built
customer_reviews.text: I really like the build of the ramp, just wish it was lighter. Bought it for my mother who could not lift it easily. If she had to move this thing around, she might as well pick up the dog we were trying to help her with.
customer_reviews.author: EmTB

customer_reviews.title: I love this ramp and so do my dogs
customer_reviews.text: I love this ramp and so do my dogs. I like the material - it's a little soft which I less is less scary when training dogs to use it. I used to own a ramp exactly like this one years and years ago and I'm glad I bought this again. Easy to use, I like there's a lock on it, and it's very strong. I have a 130 pound mastiff and it's great for him.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie Lunder

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: This ramp is great. My 15 year old Lab/Chow mix took to it right away and has no trouble using it. It is strong and solid, and folds easily for storage. The raised traction bars help her keep her footing even if paws are wet, and we are using it for the 3 step entry into the house as well as in and out of my Nissan Titan. So far so good and I have no reservations recommending this ramp to fellow pet owners!
customer_reviews.author: John Swift

customer_reviews.title: Good Value
customer_reviews.text: Much easier to use than a sliding ramp that I had before. I’m 5’ 2” and a light weight, and at first it seemed awkward to open, but I found it to be pretty easy to handle after using it a few times.
customer_reviews.author: Judith Irene

customer_reviews.title: Great ramp! Don’t hesitate!
customer_reviews.text: It’s been so much easier for our Dog Maile to get into the house. It’s well made, sturdy, and the perfect size for our steps. I highly recommend this to anyone considering a ramp for their dog with hip issues. Wish I had bought it sooner!
customer_reviews.author: Linda Lenz

customer_reviews.title: It’s worth it.
customer_reviews.text: I have a large dog with problem joints and 3 steps down the back porch. It is taking time for him to get used to it but he’s coming around. I had to walk it to show him. It bends a little under my 170 lbs so I am not sure about the 200 lbs capability but it works great the price is good.
customer_reviews.author: Pollard

customer_reviews.title: Saves my back.
customer_reviews.text: The pet ramp saves my back from having to lift my two Bassett Hounds into the car each day. Works great.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal

customer_reviews.title: sturdy & durable
customer_reviews.text: it's study. I can walk on it easily and I'm 150lbs It does give a bit in the middle thats to be expected with weight on it. Easy to carry. Very portable. Unfortunately my Bassett hound is silly scared of all things new 🙃 Soooo this didn't go as planned at all 😂
customer_reviews.author: Jacqui

customer_reviews.title: Great ramp
customer_reviews.text: It's a very solid, sturdy ramp. This is my second one from this company. My dog is 12 and has arthritis and hip dysplasia. These ramps work great for her. The only downside is it is a bit heavy. But I have a bad back, so theres that...
customer_reviews.author: linda

customer_reviews.title: Great for dogs!
customer_reviews.text: We got this for our 2 German Shepherds to use getting in/out of our Tahoe after one suffered an injury and had to stop jumping. Our vet told us such high jumps can cause joint problems in the future, so we needed a permanent solution. We love this ramp! We followed the training tips and Heidi & Hanz now get in and out with ease, and love their "new ramp game". The fact that it folds in half means we can take the ramp with us and they never have to jump.
customer_reviews.author: Heidi

customer_reviews.title: Strong and looks like it will last
customer_reviews.text: Just as I expected. Strong and looks like it will last. Since I'm aware of other reviewers pinching their fingers, this as not been an issue and is easy to use. It is somewhat heavy, but I wanted strong. Our dog is 60+ lbs at 6 mos. and still growing, so I wanted it to be sturdy. He didn't want to use it at first, but through training he'll put up with it using treats and tugging on the leash. It's saves my back, he's getting too heavy to lift and having him learn to jump can lead to hip dysplasia.
customer_reviews.author: selective buyer

customer_reviews.title: well made doggie ramp
customer_reviews.text: My senior dog has a tough time getting into and out of my truck. The ramp is just what he needed to continue hanging out with me when we travel. Its a bit on the awkward side, a little heavy, but the ramp does the trick,
customer_reviews.author: Mike Young

customer_reviews.title: This ramp works great!
customer_reviews.text: I have a large, aging dog who has arthritis, so she can no longer jump in and out of the car. This ramp works great! She learned to use it very quickly. The surface makes it easy for her to walk up. It is easy to fold and unfold and put in the car. We both are so happy to be able to go places together again.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah J. Parsons

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, durable, helpful.
customer_reviews.text: This ramp is very sturdy! The surface design & non-skid material is great! It’s a bit heavy & not especially easy for me to maneuver- opening/closing it while trying to hold it is a little difficult but I’ve been able to manage & it’s certainly easier than lifting a large dog into the car! I don’t know what could be done to make it less heavy/cumbersome yet maintain its sturdiness & durability. After some practice runs in the house, the dogs took to it & like using it especially when there’s a treat reward!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Have a Heavy dog....this is a must
customer_reviews.text: While I was sent the wrong color, which I wasn't thrilled about...this pet ramp is AMAZING. Its sturdy, easy to use and my dogs are happy to go up and down it. Plus is saves my back!!
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and easy confidence for our mastiff
customer_reviews.text: We have a giant English Mastiff and it took her no time to get used to it. She weighs 150lbs and it’s sturdy textured grip gave her the confidence to quickly learn that this is she enters and exits the suv. We love it.
customer_reviews.author: M. S.

customer_reviews.title: Super Sturdy, reliable ramp for our old girl.
customer_reviews.text: Bought two of these ramps to help our twelve year old black Lab maneuver two sets of stairs on the back deck of our new home. She was hesitant at first, but now she uses them without our having to coax her. And she manages them now like a champ. These ramps are very sturdy and the rubber surface helps her grip as she climbs the gentle slope. Highly reccomend this product. ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐
customer_reviews.author: JGF

customer_reviews.title: Practical entree for dogs to SUV or truck to avoid injury
customer_reviews.text: This replaces one we had for years. Initially received a defective product which was immediately replaced. Good safety item to allow dogs to enter vehicle and avoid jumping uo with potential for damaging hips or legs. Especially useful if there will be multiple stops to keep your dog safe !
customer_reviews.author: charlie badger

customer_reviews.title: Heavy but it works.
customer_reviews.text: I like the fact I can use this to get my dog into our vehicle. I keep it in the back of the vehicle. However it IS clumsy getting it out and unopened. It’s heavy. The always end up pinching my finders in the process. Maybe I’M just clumsy!!
customer_reviews.author: Candy M

customer_reviews.title: Safe, Solid, Non-marring
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for our 50-pound dog, for use following surgery, to reduce the risk of post-op hernia. Trained him on it prior to surgery, since he's used to jumping in and out of the van. Dog navigated it just fine, even in post-anesthesia haze :-). Also used indoors to get him on and off the grooming table. All surfaces are coated, so there's nothing to scratch the vehicle's paint. When folded, ramp kept closed with a coil spring, protected with a bit of clear tubing. Simple solution that works just fine. Notch in rails well-placed to carrying when folded. Rubber pads help resist slipping off the bumper when the dog is walking the ramp. Definitely recommend to dog friends.
customer_reviews.author: TervFan

customer_reviews.title: Great ramp and very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: This is the third Pet step I have owned. The last one broke after years of use. I have a 200 lb pig that uses it and the grippy tread is excellent for hooves!
customer_reviews.author: Chris W

customer_reviews.title: I use this for outdoors
customer_reviews.text: looked into something that was portable AND would hold up in our winter snows. Been very pleased with this product. Following their instructions, I got my dog to use it within a few hours. It has been out in all sorts of weather and seems to be holding up well. I like that it will not rust, folds easily and quickly, and has rubber strips to give them traction. Unlike other similar products, this rubber strip seems to be the superior product. The box it arrived in was damaged but maybe that was it was so bulky. It was in pristine condition. This is helping my dog tremendously with her mobility issues.
customer_reviews.author: Trish

customer_reviews.title: Nice ramp
customer_reviews.text: This is a really nice ramp! It's lightweight enough to move it around, and folding it is easy. I couldn't see putting this in my car, unless you are driving a Suburban or something similar, as it would take up a lot of room, even when folded. Unfortunately even after weeks of trying to train my "old" dog to use it, she refused to use it.
customer_reviews.author: randy21mTop Contributor: Baseball

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this ramp. I use it for my pet piggies. This is the second one I have bought (one for the house and one for the car) I have tried others, they don't usually hold up as well, only downfall is it is a bit heavy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Up up and into the truck...easy!
customer_reviews.text: This ramp worked great! We had it for years, finally had to have a wider ramp (older and more dogs all trying to get down this narrow ramp wasn't working!). We used it hard and for a long time. I'd recommend it and buy it again if our ATV (all terrain vehicle) tri-fold, plywood reinfoced solid aluminum ramp ever fails (LOL).
customer_reviews.author: Steve Foreaker

customer_reviews.title: Great ramp for a disabled dog
customer_reviews.text: This is the second ramp I've purchased for my three-legged dog. He manages this ramp much better than the original one I purchased. This has a non-skid rubber surface and is very sturdy. The one I bought previously was a big shorter and has a sand paper type surface. This ramp weighs about 18 pounds which is manageable, but not really easy to cart around. I'm so glad I bought this.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: PetSTEP Original Folding Pet Ramp
product_meta.description:
Color:Graphite/Gray

The original PetSTEP Folding 70" Pet Ramp is the perfect accessory to help pets climb in and out of the back of vehicles as well as on and off tables/furniture such as exam tables, sofas, beds or even up and down stairs with ease. This ramp has a gentle slope that provides assistance to pets that cannot leap onto high surfaces. 

The Folding 70" Pet Ramp by PetSTEP is made from high-quality plastic materials, which makes it sturdy and durable. The ramp has several safety features including a unique non-slip ridged surface that is not found on other ramps. This surface is soft on pets paws and helps pets maintain grip and traction. Plus there are no materials used such as carpet, tape, or sandpaper that can trap in odors. A soft heavy duty rubber universal non-slip grip is found on each end that fits vehicles and edges. 

This lightweight (18.5 lbs) portable ramp can be folded in half and has molded ergonomic handles built in on each side making it easy to carry and store. Easy to setup and low on maintenance, this ramp can be cleaned with soap and water. The base of this ramp maintains traction which helps secure the ramp in place as pets use it to climb up or down. The total weight capacity for this ramp is 500 lbs. (for use with 4 legged animals only).

To use, simply unfold the ramp and prop one end against a truck bed, vet table, or top step. Animals can walk up or down at a gentle incline, instead of struggling, jumping, or being lifted. With its sturdy structure and rubberized surface, the ramp helps reduce arthritis and dysplasia pain, lowers the chances of injury, and cuts down on back strain.

The Folding 70" Pet Ramp by PetSTEP is an excellent item for newborn or older animals as well as for pets that require special care and attention. This ramp makes an excellent addition to any home with pets.
feature_bullets: Unique soft non-slip rubberized walking surface. Superior Traction in wet or dry conditions. No sandpaper or carpet making it soft on paws
Universal non-slip grip fits all vehicles and edges
Folds in half for easy storage and portability (molded ergonomic handles on both sides)- opens and closes in seconds (no hardware required)
Advanced composite plastic construction holds up to 500 lbs (animal use only)
Will not rust or corrode and can be cleaned with soap and water. Reduces arthritis & dysplasia pain.

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
